info.headline: Frost Advisory issued December 17 at 11:36AM PST until December 18 at 9:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures 28 to 32 degrees will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 5 to 15 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * WHERE...Gusty winds may occur below the Cajon and San Gorgonio Passes today. Cold temperatures expected across the Inland Empire. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 9 AM PST Saturday. For the Wind Advisory, until 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will begin to ease tonight into Saturday morning. Another cold morning is expected on Sunday.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
